title: WATCH: Wycombe's thrilling comeback!
description: Wycombe came from 3-2 down to secure a thrilling 4-3 win in stoppage time against Carlisle in Sky Bet League Two on Saturday.
content: After Matt Bloomfield and Luke O'Nien put the hosts 2-0 with goals either side of the half-hour mark, it looked as though it would be plain sailing for the promotion-hopefuls at Adams Park.But when O'Nien received his marching orders mere minutes into the second half, the tide turned. Danny Grainger tucked away the penalty conceded by O'Nien, before Jamie Devitt equalised with a header after 68 minutes.Cole Stockton put Carlisle in the lead two minutes later to complete the turnaround and that looked like that would be that. But the story still had plenty of twists to play out.Stoppage time began with the Cumbrians retaining their lead, before Paris Cowan-Hall netted an equaliser three minutes in and three minutes later, Marcus Bean volleyed his first Wycombe goal to shock the travelling fans and maintain the push for automatic promotion.You can see how the Chairboys' thrilling comeback took shape by clicking the video above!
